alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Darlington and central Marlboro Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Cheraw State Park, or 7 miles southwest of Bennettsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Mccoll, Clio, Dunbar, Chavistown, Society Hill, Blenheim and Tatum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
